results.abstract: Article on Pres Council on Physical Fitness and Sports expanding to include wide range of new programs; programs detailed

headline.main: U.S. Physical Fitness Council Widening Programs

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 -- The professionals who took over the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports almost a year ago are starting a wide range of new programs.

byline.original: Special to the New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 -- The professionals who took over the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports almost a year ago are starting a wide range of new programs.

headline.main: Happy Day Is Here Again; Happy Day Is Here

results.snippet: IT happens every year, as regularly as Groundhog Day, August White Sales and Governor Rockefeller's nasal pronouncement that the state is headed for fiscal disaster unless he raises taxes. So it comes as no surprise that, once again, "The Doris Day...

byline.original: By DONALD K. EPSTEIN and DICK DeBARTOLO

results.lead_paragraph: IT happens every year, as regularly as Groundhog Day, August White Sales and Governor Rockefeller's nasal pronouncement that the state is headed for fiscal disaster unless he raises taxes. So it comes as no surprise that, once again, "The Doris Day Show" has been completely redesigned. New format. New supporting cast. New production staff.

headline.main: 58 LAYERS FOUND IN LUNAR SAMPLE; Astronaut, in Brussels Talk, Calls Them 'Chapters' of Solar History

results.snippet: BRUSSELS, Sept. 20 -- Analysis of the nine-foot core extracted from the lunar surface by the Apollo 15 astronauts has disclosed 58 distinct layers representing 58 "chapters in the history of the sun," the leader of that mission reported here today.

byline.original: By WALTER SULLIVANSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS, Sept. 20 -- Analysis of the nine-foot core extracted from the lunar surface by the Apollo 15 astronauts has disclosed 58 distinct layers representing 58 "chapters in the history of the sun," the leader of that mission reported here today.

headline.main: Designs of the Decade; Designs of the Decade

results.abstract: USSR space med specialists rept USSR astronauts carry special antiradiation drugs on all space flights but note they have never used them, Internatl Astronautical Cong session; concede such drugs are dangerous; say they would only be used if solar eruption threatened to flood spacecraft cabin with high-energy radiation; astronaut Dr B G Yegorov argues that solar flares are unpredictable and having such drugs aboard spacecraft is sensible precaution (W Sullivan rept)

headline.main: SOVIET SPACEMEN CARRY A RAY DRUG; But Experts Say Medicine Has Never Been Used

results.snippet: BRUSSELS, Sept. 25 -- According to Soviet specialists in space medicine, Soviet astronauts carry a special antiradiation drug on all space flights but have never used it so far, either in space or in preparation for a flight.

byline.original: By WALTER SULLIVANSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS, Sept. 25 -- According to Soviet specialists in space medicine, Soviet astronauts carry a special antiradiation drug on all space flights but have never used it so far, either in space or in preparation for a flight.

headline.main: Wood, Field and Stream: Hunt Ritual

results.snippet: LANDER, Wyo. -- Beneath snow-draped conifers at the Sinks Canyon rifle range, hunters participating in the Lander one-shot antelope hunt gathered round several open fires, where strong black coffee steamed, and warmed numbed fingers before the men...

byline.original: By NELSON BRYANTSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LANDER, Wyo. -- Beneath snow-draped conifers at the Sinks Canyon rifle range, hunters participating in the Lander one-shot antelope hunt gathered round several open fires, where strong black coffee steamed, and warmed numbed fingers before the men stepped to the firing line.

headline.main: Wood, Field and Stream: An Antelope Hunter Is Led Astray

results.snippet: LANDER, Wyo. -- High in the snow-covered foothills of Wyoming's Wind River Mountains, a Lander rancher, Jack Brodie, crouched, then waved for me to approach. Peering over a rock, I saw a herd of antelope 150 yards away.

byline.original: By NELSON BRYANTSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LANDER, Wyo. -- High in the snow-covered foothills of Wyoming's Wind River Mountains, a Lander rancher, Jack Brodie, crouched, then waved for me to approach. Peering over a rock, I saw a herd of antelope 150 yards away.
